title: Crowded but happening market
review: Library bazaar is a very crowded place. But it is actually a very happening place to visit as it has lots of shopping as well as restaurant options.

title: Its not a bazar but an entry point for Mall road and junction for vehicles to stop
review: It's not a Bazar but a place from where Mall road begins. The vehicles drop us off here and then we have to either take a cycle Riksha or walk. It's a cluster of shops/cafes and a medical store. There's a photo op at the shelter near the chowk.

title: OK OK place
review: As said this place is at Gandhi chowk and start or u can say end of mall road.

title: One of the two centers of activity in Mussoorie's Mall Road
review: Most of the tourists walk the semi-circular road from Picture Palace to Library via Jhula Ghar and Ritz cinema. Motorized vehicles are not allowed in this area during day time. There are barriers on both ends-Library and Picture Palace.  Library is an old building around which market gets thickened just like the market close to Picture Palace. There are a few good sweet shops, restaurants and view points near Library Bazar. The area is much wider as compared to Picture Palace. A little away from this place you can get shared jeeps for Kempty fall.

title: Library chowk. Mussoorie
review: The Library chowk and the Picture Palace are two ends of Mall Road or main Mussoorie town.The Library and the Picture  Palace are just different. I can't say which one is better but I can try to suggest so that the  Library lovers like me can make a choice.

title: Just a drop of point.
review: Its only a srop of point . Crowded chowk . No great shops around. Nor any eateries. No clue why there is such a crowd there. Its not a must do. Go to main mall road or the picture palace end.

title: less crowded
review: library end is one of the two ends of the mussoorie mall road....this one is a less crowded one....this is certainly wider than the picture palace end...

title: Heart of Mussoorie
review: This chowk is known for a drop off location. Mussoorie market starts from this place. There are multiple food joints are also available.

title: part of mall road
review: Always crowded with vehicles and tourist, its a very happening place of mussoorie. I always choose to stay close to library end to enjoy that place in evening. One can visit this market along with mall road. Shopping, gifts, daily needs, eateries all are here with a view doon valley

title: just average
review: it is near mall road. nothing special in this market. yes you can take rest here after long walk of mall road and take sweet corn.

title: A best place to sit out
review: Library bazaar is the most famous point, as the road coming from Mall Road intersects at this very point, the State Roadways office, taxi stand is also at a walking distance from this point. One can find lots of eateries at this place as the place is full of different varieties of hotels and restaurants.

title: Boring
review: Not a very good place for shopping but it is one of the main attractions of the town..  It's full of hustle bustle and a nice place for a walk

title: Local market
review: Library bazaar is a local market, where you can get almost all items. It is near library Chowk. A good number of eateries are also there.

title: Heart of mussorie
review: The library chowk is the place where you will find numerous shops and food joints. The place offers a nice walk to know about mussorie and its culture.

title: A bustling Bazaar
review: The Library Chowk is one end of the Mussoorie Mall Road. The Fortune Hotel is nearby and besides some shops the main taxi stand is just a few steps away.

title: Òne corner of mall road
review: Library bazar is the one corner of the big mall road,near this place a beautiful  gurudwara can be visited.

title: nice
review: Library chowk is the main market and very crowded area having a lot of shops and vehicles with having a very good scenic point. Basically it is a starting point of mall road with restaurants souvenirs shops and varieties stores where tourist enjoys shopping and eating.

title: Nice market
review: It is nice to walk on the mall. library Bazaar has some interesting shops and restaurants. nice place to indulge is souvenir shopping.

title: One end of Mall Road
review: The Library Bazaar is located near the old Library. It is located at one end of Mall Road.  There is a statue of Mahatma Gandhi and also a gazebo where one can sit in the shade and get a view of the valley.  The taxi stand is very close.  There a a large number of shops and one can get just about anything required for daily needs.  There are photographer around who will take your pictures with great backgrounds.

title: Not a bazaar - just a crowded place
review: Library Bazaar is not a bazaar at all.  It is just a small area in front of the Library building (now defunct) with a number of dilapidated shops and eateries.  It is dirty and dangerous as vehicles use it to turn around to return back to Dehra Dun.

title: too much hyped
review: the Mall road from the library side is too much hyped and not much to rave about. ordinary shops selling chinese goods are there and does not give the feel of a hill station walk street

title: Just Another Shopping Street !!
review: Library bazaar starts from Library chowk and ends just 200 mtrs down the mall road.

title: You can get anything and everything
review: It has become just like any another market in the city. If you're looking for some handicrafts and some tibetan trinkets, you should better head for picture palace market on the landour road. Just take a walk through this place and you'll realise it's not worth your money.

title: Crowded but the heart Mussoorie
review: The Library Bazaar is always crowded and there is almost always a traffic jam here. But at the same time it is the place to go when in Mussoorie. At one end is the old Mussoorie library off limits for the tourist. There is a nice viewing platform nearby. The Mall road starts from the traffic barrier here. Nice restaurants line up on left side of the road

title: Crowded Marketplace
review: Library Bazar and the Chowk area is a congested place near one end of Mall Road.

title: Utter chaos and mismanagement by local authorities
review: Mussourie is and old hill station with no development at all and full of dirt on the streets and unruly traffic. The police doesn't seem to have a clue on what they can do to manage the traffic accept contributing to the noise pollution by shouting on loud speakers. The entire city is full of encroachments and bears a worn off look. The is no tourist friendly spot. The local restaurants are generally quite dirty with untidy waiters. You will definitely find lots of spits all around.

title: Must visit place
review: Similar to Mall road in Shimka albeit not as long as Shimla. View of valley in the night from library chowk is wonderful. Cycles on rent are available for those want to do cycling on traffic free riad. Stroller is also available on rent. Must visit Jhoolagar

title: nothing special
review: very crowdy road and very costly products. you can spend an evening here and can see different type of peoples. you can take a cycle on rent.

title: Crowded during weekends
review: It is one of the busied place in Mussoorie. It is named because of presence of Library there. Almost all types of items you can buy from here.

title: Good valley view, ordinary market
review: Valley view is pleasant. There is a Gandhi statue at intersection. Pic lovers can click few pics here.

title: THE LIBRARY - What is it?  Where is it?
review: For most of us The Library is viewed synonymously as referring to The Library Bazaar.  However, this western end of the Mall was seen in earlier times as the location of the Public Library.  Today the ‘roundabout statue’ location here is adjacent to what was once a Public Library, indeed the sign designating The Library can still be seen above the shops.  Facing west towards the Sign and on the Right adjacent to the road to Happy Valley you will find steps leading upstairs to The Library.  However, my feeling is that today this once Public Library might serve as a Club of sorts as the large sign on the steps wall states “MEMBERS ONLY “ --- hardly a sign one would use to designate Public Use.

title: Nice
review: Library Bazaar is located strategically in Mussoorie's bustling Mall Road. The place is so named as it is in the vicinity of Mussurie

title: nice place to have a walk in the night
review: it is simply the mall road , you can shop here, can have vareity of food from here

title: A decent place to walk around in the evening
review: Near library bazaar bus stand, it is a part of the mall road. One can go for road side purchases, can eat Maggie and enjoy the walk around with doon view. 4 wheelers movement is not allowed in the evening on this bazaar.

title: Crowded noisy place
review: I found this place most crowded, full of noice and traffic. This place have some eating outlets which serving food at very reasonable rates without compromising the quality.

title: The Most Happening Place
review: The Most Happening Place

title: Crowded place
review: On my recent visited I had a one day stay at one of the hotels on Library bazaar. The road is full of  people at any all point of time which makes it very happening. Here one can find a good variety of restaurants and hotels to stay in as well  as good shops are present here.

title: Center of Mussoorie
review: All roads in Mussoorie leads or starts from here. One great thing is the taxis are fully controlled by the taxi association and hence all the rates are fully fixed.

title: Mass Organized Smooth Flowing Confusion
review: The Library side of the Mall is the primary tributary feed up from Dehradun and it is here at the confluence of 3 roads, a Roundabout, a gate and shops that I am reminded of a scene in the forest when one steps accidents on an Ant Nest! Bedlam but somehow it has the hidden appearance of "This Is Working" ok... Patience required.  The building facing the main road coming UP from Rajpur area is the former Library, and thus the origin of the name for the West side of the Mall Road.  I found it interesting to see a sign off to the Right at the bottom of some steps "Mussoorie Library" and an Up Arrow. On checking further another surprise..  "For Members Only".  Go figure! For the history buffs you will find the Net has more info on the origin of The Library, which is now more of a location than a specific public Library.

title: Nothing much
review: There are a few random shops. It is very crowded and even though it was a pedestrian street, it was difficult to walk.

title: Crowded downtown mussoorie
review: This ever crowded place in mussoorie is a round about with 4 roads leading to different parts of mussoorie. Its got a market and some restaurants nearby. You will almost always cross this at some point of time. You should get down, get a view of the valley and then walk towards the mall road for shopping, eating and walking! There are some restaurants here but the better ones are on the other side of the mall road

title: Walking and Shopping
review: This is very good place where u ll get food,books,antic items and all other shopping varieties.Its a nice place where u can enjoy shopping and walking.

title: Enjoy the shopping
review: Large number of small shops for eating and shopping. Lots of street vendor's selling everything as in any other mall road in any other hill station. The weather was awesome and enjoyed the walk though it was crowded.

title: Shop while you walk !!
review: The Library Bazaar or popularly known as Mall road is the place to spend your evening in Mussoorie. There are plenty shopping options, restaurants to eat out and places to visit like Jawahar Aquarium, Gun Hill Point, Camel Back road, etc.

title: It's Cool!!
review: The Queen of Hills in India! I'm not going to add any thing new in it. During the hot summer of planes in India still you'll need some warm clothes there if walking down the streets in late evening. Ladies & Kids enjoyed a lot of walking around the bazaar street, selfies, snacks & shopping also, which is quite reasonable in comparison to other tourist destinations. The only problem is parking & it's common phenomenon nowadays during peak season on the hills. It's my second visit but first time with family & next time I'm planning to go there in off season.

title: Just like any other crowded Indian street..
review: Nothing special about the area other than neck braking traffic and lots of people.. Can go to this place only if one wants to buy stuff. May food joints and little shops are present but hygiene is questionable.

title: Nothing special. Just a regular mall road .
review: Gandhi chowk and the surroundings are a group of shops, establishments and restaurants around a junction with a view of the valley. And that's all there is to it.

title: Leisure
review: Nice place to stay and move around. you can get local fashionable accessories for young girls. This is heart of the city. you can jolly well spent your day . There are lot places to eat.

title: The West side of the Mussoire Mall
review: The Mall runs from Library Side to the East side being Picture Palace, and faces the south or plains of North India.  To my understanding the name Library originated from their being a Library just at the west end.  Today the area is crowded with shops, nots being of the smaller and specialising type.  The ubiquitous food stalls present as usual.  The Library side gives you access to three 'routes' as it were; Camels Back Road and Happy Valley and the third being to wall along the Mall to the East end where you find even more route options. Great views of Vally below, when visibility is good.

title: A good place to roam
review: It's an attractive and crowdy place to roam and have some good food. Alot Food options are there. Though market is not well developed. Have a visit and have a walk.

title: Please Note Mussoorie has two Bus Stands
review: Uttarakhand State Transport Buses run between Dehradun and Mussoorie at regular intervals. Mussoorie has two Bus stands, LIbrary Bus Stand & Picture Palace Bus stand. Before boarding the Bus you must know which Bus stand is nearer to your hotel and accordingly choose your Bus.  Perhaps most of the hotels are nearer to Library Stand. If you land in Picture Palace Bus stand but your hotel is near Library Stand then you are to take a cab and spend minimum Rs. 200/- to reach library chowk or your hotel, as it happened to me.

title: The Heart of Mussoorie
review: It's just like any other mall road on an Indian hill station. But it's the heart of Mussoorie. Teeming with life. Little cafes and shops all along. Just walk along shopping or window shopping or just sit in one of the cafes and watch life go by!!!

title: A lot to do on the road!
review: One of the best Mall roads compared to those of Nainital, Manali and McLoedganj. A lot of good eatries are located alongside the road.There are stalls selling maggi, momos, omletts, corn as well as shopping stalls.You can get good stuff if you bargain right.

title: The shopping destination
review: This place is just perfect for a shopping on a trip at evening. Indulge in gorging some local cuisine as you eat in the shops in this bazaar. This place offers you an ideal location to bring home souvenirs.

title: Good shopping and eating options
review: Nice walk and enjoy the beauty of Mussourie. You can indulge yourself in some quick shopping and munching too!! Those who are having problem in walking then cycle rickshaw are also available.

title: A memorable walk
review: It is long walk with shopping places around. You also get nice valley views and you can sit and relax. Evening walks are pleasant.  You also get nice food joints. You can meet Ruskin Bond , the great English  writer at Cambridge stores during weekends.

title: Good market with oriental look
review: This is one end of mall road and one of the centre attraction  point of city. You can do shopping ,wander and enjoy the old market look with some very old well maintained structures and busy but not overcrowded place. You can also enjoy the scenic beauty from this place of entire town and simply rest for some time

title: charming market
review: charming market, popular with tourists. little crowded. good for visitors. all sort of traditional things are available

title: Happening place in Mussoorie!!
review: Located at one end of the Mall road of Queen of Hills Mussoorie. Very happening place, always crowded with tourists. Just take walk in evening, its very relaxing . You also get to see nice valley views and you can sit and relax. You can also do shopping and eat from local food stalls. Nice place.

title: A Small Beautiful Town Centre
review: The library is the centre piece of the bazaar. There are all types of shops and restaurants here.

title: Roadside Market overlooking the Hills
review: The Library Bazar is a quintessential market which overlooks the pristine hillls. One can shop to their hearts content - roadside stalls selling corn, boiled eggs, panipuri, momo, kababs, balloons, hats, colorful winter wear, wooden articles, bells, gift items and a myriad of essential and non-essential products.

title: Has it all
review: This place has it all. You can find anything that you need. From food to medicines to a coffee shop. With the view of the valley.

title: Great hangout place
review: Towards beginning of mall road, this place is very popular and often crowded. There are lots of eating options.

title: Very crowded but outstanding simulation of the Indian life
review: The streets were littered with trash, the scenery described the average Indian life, and it showed us the poverty and a ferris wheel that a guy was climbing and doing flips and walking upside down. The problem is half of the stuff is junk and half the stuff is real so you have to infer from the brands

title: The crowded end of Mall road
review: This is from where the Mall road starts and it's super crowded at any point of time. There are some nice hotels and the library of course.

title: Nice place to shop..
review: Nice place to roam around and shop clothes, shoes, accessories and eat.. With good restaurants and shops to shop it is a must visit place in mussorie..

title: Nice bazaar
review: The main market of Mussoorie, enjoy walking on the road. However shops are very costly and sold many items more then of MRP. You will find so many local items while walking on the road and enjoying the view of hill station with your loved once, you can have romantic views in evening.

title: Crowded it is...meant to be so!
review: No one can stop any one from going there!

title: Offers good eating options. Shopping is a bit expensive
review: Offers good eating options. Shopping is a bit expensive

title: Nice town centre
review: It is the starting point of famous mall road. Library is the centre piece of this bazar but only members can go inside. There are lot of shops and restaurants in this area. There is also viewing point from where one can see the beautiful valley. It is always crowded and unfortunately it is not kept clean but still it is worth seeing at least once.

title: Main nerve center
review: This is the main nerve center of Mussoorie. The Mall road starts here,the road towards Kempty falls goes from the side of the library.

title: This is what mussoorie is
review: it's the heart of mussoorie ... mall road starts here and upto other end it's full of games corner, market and upstreat resturants ... awesome

title: Walk among the clouds
review: When I was there, it was rainy day in Dehradun. But in mussoorie, in Mussoorie the weather was pleasant. Not too cold,not hot at all n not at all humid. But in no time, the clouds flew from the  valley n there was fog in a lil while. U can't imaging the moment if u haven't lived one. So be there. U vl always love it.

title: Most happening place if Mussoorie
review: Library square is always buzzing with tourists and local people. The view point with garden chairs is a great place to relax and enjoy the market place. You can also visit the library which is a heritage building. You can get lot of options in trying street food.

title: City Centre of Mussourie
review: The Library Bazaar of Mussourie is a crowded area with lots of shops, restaurants and hotels thronging along and jostling for space. It is always buzzing with tourists and local people. The view point with garden chairs is a great place to relax and enjoy the market place. One can also visit the library which is a heritage building. Mussourie is extremely popular in Uttarakhand and is very close to Delhi. People drive down here in the weekends to enjoy a quick gateway.

title: Main Market for tourists in Mussorie
review: This baazar is at famous library Chowk. Near by mall road. Has many food shops restaurants, shops to buy things like souvenirs. But a little expensive. Lot of things to buy you can see is not local things almost things are from delhi and Chinese items so if you're looking for some local things to buy it's very hard to find. Market is open from morning 9 to 10 evening.

title: Down the memory lane.
review: The library load is main shopping area in Mussourie.  The road is well maintained.  The development authority has give seats on frequent intervals.  Walk along the road givea sence of nostalgia.  The area is very safe even in late evenings.

title: NICE MARKET NEAR MALL ROAD
review: Library Bazar is on the one end of mall road with  restaurants souvenirs shops and varieties stores where tourist  enjoys  shopping and eating. Main Library is located on the intersection of this market. This bazaar is always crowded in the season.

title: over crowded on weekends and holidays
review: very saturated small road that is over crowded on weekends and holidays.

title: Good Shopping Bazzar
review: You will find everything goods, foods, grossary, medicines on this road. Little bit crowds with people during holidays and weekends

title: Complete mad house
review: Complete mad house with hotels, restaurants( nice joints towards landau) and streets shops selling cheap quality woolen clothes etc. There is Manual Merry go round place as well.

title: Very Good area for shopping and dining.
review: Library bazaar starts from Library Point in Mussoorie, and goes on in the Mall Road. Here, you can find all types of clothes, ranging from shawls to sweaters for toddlers. And that too, in very cheap (compared to Delhi).

title: Don't miss the Library @ the Library Bazaar
review: I almost didn't make it to the library. From outside it didn't look imposing enough. But the year 1843 made me go closer. A set of rickety wooden steps next to a shop took me up.

title: Right on top of the Tavern
review: This is the central most place on the mall road that has an old green paint chipping off its banner. Plenty of tomes for book-lovers. There are nice cafes for you to catch up on your read.

title: Shopping Area
review: Bazzar is also known as Gandhi Chowk near old library. name of Bazzar is derived from Library built in 19th Century.There is a statue of Mahatma Gandhi here and that is why the bazzar is called as Gandhi Chowk.there are so many shops and stalls on both side of path.Over all a shoping Area.

title: Typical hill station touristy market
review: It's a typical hill station touristy market selling woollen clothes , dresses , cheap imported clothes and souvenirs etc, but obliviously a must visit if you are travelling with wife.

title: Very reasonable market
review: It's on the other hill. Actually there are two main places in Mussoorie one starting from Library Bazaar and second starting from Clock Tower or Mall Road. I found Library Bazaar more convenient place to shop. Usually traffic is not allowed on this road. The rates were reasonable. There is a sweet shop when you enter the market they sell Mussoorie special sweet called "bal mithai" at 340 per Kg. We could only buy 500g and owner asked us to come again in 1 hr. Do negotiate as shop owners set price and leave option for bargaining.

title: Sardarji's shop
review: the shop of sardar ji is there from which you can buy the things such as milk, bread/butter and other daily use things on the mrp's. it's adjacent to hotel mall view. the rooms on library road hotels are not good and pricing high. Give a try to Hotel Surya Kiran on mall road for nice stay and fooding.

title: Average Place!
review: The market is cheap as compared to the other side of Mall road. But there is a HEAVY TRAFFIC! There is so much bad smell of burning Engine Oil. There is huge crowd. There is a decent view of mountains.

title: Nice place for evening stroll
review: It's a nice place for evening stroll . Most of the shops are well decorated. Nevertheless place become chaos in the morning due to traffic jams.

title: crowded but full of variety
review: The Library Bazaar of Mussoorie is a crowded area with lots of shops,restaurants and hotels. It is situated at the entry of Mussoorie. You can pass your time here by eating at the roadside stalls or by eating at the very good restaurants of your choice.If you want to have some lavish food,you should go to the restaurant of Hotel Imperial Square.You can just roam here.It is a friendly place at the entry of the city.The shops on one side and the valley on the other side looks very good.Overall,its a must.

title: Typical tourist place market
review: Just average market.  However you can enjoy the street food.  Just stroll & do the window shopping.  Just buy some wood items for your souvenir.

title: Typical loçl tourist market
review: Nothing spl mostly games for children and cloth shops just havig a walk gives enjoymnt  mostly very crowdd on weekends

title: Shop till you drop; chomp on the go
review: A market filled with chinese merchandise. Timepass place. Feast on corn cobs, boiled eggs and bargain for bags, chappals, stoles, shawls. A lot of price variation.

title: good woollen clothes
review: I visited here when most of the shops were offering season end sales.  and was lucky enough to stuck some good bargains here.
